title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
description: When trying to change the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the expected behavior is for the children nodes to be listed out after the change.
OB: Currently, when attempting to change the data source, no children nodes are being listed out.
EB: The expected behavior is that when the data source is changed, the new data source's children should be listed out.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps: 
1. Open the data set editor page in the query tab.
2. Select a data set.
3. Click on the option to change the data source for the data set.
4. Observe that no children nodes are being listed out after the data source change.
